Historic Hawke’s Bay: ‘No flies on the meat’ — Havelock North butcher’s impressive claim https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/historic-hawkes-bay-no-flies-on-the-meat-havelock-north-butchers-impressive-claim/6DJJIPZ2XNBBNJOUA2EXK5Q3GM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/historic-hawkes-bay-no-flies-on-the-meat-havelock-north-butchers-impressive-claim/6DJJIPZ2XNBBNJOUA2EXK5Q3GM/ Michael FowlerThis would not have been an easy task, with the meat hanging outside during summer. Fri, 07 Jun 2024 18:00:00 +0000 Arthur Dillon’s butcher shop in Middle Rd, Havelock (North) in 1898. Dillon is holding the horse’s reins, and near him is an unidentified employee. The position of the butcher shop, and the Presbyterian church on its right, is where Gilmours Pharmacy is today.

Te Puka Tavern: Owner of iconic East Coast pub is ‘one lucky guy’ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/08/te-puka-tavern-owner-of-iconic-east-coast-pub-is-one-lucky-guy/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/08/te-puka-tavern-owner-of-iconic-east-coast-pub-is-one-lucky-guy/ His pub's on the market, and now Greg can enjoy the next chapter of his life. Fri, 07 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 In the 21 years he has owned Tokomaru Bay’s iconic Te Puka Tavern publican Greg Connelly has seen some epic parties and a few massive rain events, but he never thought he’d see a rescue helicopter land in the car park.
